example_phrases_en: Chief Complaint: Chest pain for two days.
CC: Sore throat and cough.
Patient states: 'I feel very tired all the time.'
example_phrases_ms: Keluhan Utama: Sakit dada selama dua hari.
Pesakit menyatakan: 'Saya rasa sangat letih sepanjang masa.'
Mengadu pasal sakit perut sejak semalam.
Rasa tak sedap badan sudah tiga hari.
gemini_instructions: Record the patient's primary reason for seeking medical care. Understand and interpret common Malaysian slang and colloquialisms used to describe their main problem. Keep the statement brief and direct, ideally in the patient's own words. Enclose direct quotes in quotation marks.
notes_for_scribe: Identify the most pressing issue from the patient's perspective, even if expressed informally. Be aware of regional variations in slang.

example_phrases_en: HPI: 65-year-old male presenting with two days of chest pain...
The patient is a 32-year-old female with a one-week history of cough...
Onset was sudden yesterday morning...
example_phrases_ms: RPS: Lelaki berusia 65 tahun datang dengan sakit dada selama dua hari...
Pesakit adalah wanita berusia 32 tahun dengan riwayat batuk selama seminggu...
Mari saya cerita pasal sakit saya ni...
Lepas tu, terus sakit kepala kuat.
Sakitnya kat bahagian perut bawah ni.
Sakit ni ada menjalar sampai ke belakang.
gemini_instructions: Provide a chronological account of the chief complaint using the OLDCARTS framework. Understand and interpret Malaysian slang and colloquialisms related to the onset, location, duration, character, aggravating/alleviating factors, radiation, timing, and severity of the symptoms. Include the patient's age, sex, and reason for the visit at the beginning.
notes_for_scribe: Be detailed and systematic, even when the patient's description is informal. Translate slang into more formal medical terms where appropriate while retaining the patient's narrative.

example_phrases_en: Symptoms began two days ago.
Started suddenly this morning.
Gradual onset over the past week.
example_phrases_ms: Mula-mula rasa lain macam dua hari lepas.
Start dia pagi tadi masa bangun tidur.
Dari hari Isnin lagi sakit ni.
Sejak minggu lepas lagi saya perasan.
gemini_instructions: Document when the symptoms first started, understanding informal time references in Malaysian slang.
notes_for_scribe: Note the specific time frame or event associated with the start of the symptoms, converting informal references to specific dates or times if possible.

example_phrases_en: Pain is located in the center of the chest.
Soreness is primarily in the throat.
Headache is behind the eyes.
gemini_instructions: Specify the exact location(s) where the symptom is felt, interpreting potentially vague descriptions using Malaysian slang.
notes_for_scribe: Be precise in describing the anatomical location, even if the patient uses informal terms like 'sini' or 'sebelah sini'. Clarify the location if needed.

example_phrases_en: Symptoms have lasted for two days.
The pain comes and goes.
Has been feeling this way for about a week.
example_phrases_ms: Gejala sudah berlangsung selama dua hari.
Sudah merasa seperti ini selama sekitar seminggu.
Sakit ni kejap ada kejap tak ada.
gemini_instructions: Indicate how long the symptom has been present, understanding informal references to time in Malaysian slang.
notes_for_scribe: Note if the symptom is constant, intermittent, or fluctuating, and the approximate duration using standard time units.

example_phrases_en: The pain is sharp and stabbing.
Feels like a dull ache.
The cough is dry and hacking.
example_phrases_ms: Rasa macam kena cucuk-cucuk perut ni.
gemini_instructions: Describe the nature or quality of the symptom using descriptive words, interpreting Malaysian slang terms for different sensations.
notes_for_scribe: Use the patient's own words if possible to capture the character accurately, and provide a more formal medical description alongside if appropriate.

example_phrases_en: Pain is worse with exertion.
Rest seems to make it better.
Eating spicy food aggravates the heartburn.
example_phrases_ms: Sakit bertambah buruk dengan aktivitas fisik.
Makan makanan pedas memperparah sakit maag.
Kalau jalan banyak, lagi sakit pinggang ni.
Makan pedas memang buat perut saya tak selesa.
gemini_instructions: Note any factors that worsen or improve the symptom, understanding informal descriptions of activities and remedies in Malaysian slang.
notes_for_scribe: Include specific activities, medications, or positions that affect the symptom, using clear and concise language.

example_phrases_en: The pain radiates down his left arm.
Soreness does not spread anywhere.
Headache radiates to the neck.
example_phrases_ms: Nyeri tidak menyebar ke mana pun.
Sakit dada ni ada pergi sampai ke bahu.
Dari kepala ni rasa sampai ke tengkuk.
gemini_instructions: Document if the symptom spreads to other parts of the body, understanding informal descriptions of anatomical connections in Malaysian slang.
notes_for_scribe: Specify the direction and extent of any radiation using standard anatomical terms.

example_phrases_en: Symptoms are worse at night.
Occurs intermittently throughout the day.
No specific pattern noted.
example_phrases_ms: Gejala lebih buruk pada malam hari.
Tidak ada pola khusus yang tercatat.
Selalu rasa letih di waktu petang.
gemini_instructions: Describe any temporal pattern to the symptom (e.g., constant, intermittent, diurnal variation), interpreting informal time references in Malaysian slang.
notes_for_scribe: Note if there are specific times of day or situations when the symptom is more or less pronounced, using standard time references.

example_phrases_en: Pain is rated as a 7/10.
Severity is mild and tolerable.
Patient reports the worst pain of their life (10/10).
example_phrases_ms: Pesakit melaporkan sakit terburuk dalam hidupnya (10/10).
Sakit sangat, sampai tak boleh buat kerja.
Boleh tahan lagi, tapi tak selesa.
gemini_instructions: Record the intensity of the symptom, often using a pain scale of 1 to 10. Understand and interpret informal descriptions of pain severity in Malaysian slang.
notes_for_scribe: Document the specific number given by the patient or a descriptive term, and try to correlate informal descriptions with a numerical scale if possible.

example_phrases_en: PMH: Hypertension, Diabetes.
PSH: Appendectomy at age 10.
FamHx: Father with heart disease.
SocHx: Smokes 1 pack per day.
example_phrases_ms: Ada penyakit lain yang encik/cik ada?
Dalam keluarga ada yang sakit jantung?
gemini_instructions: Document any pertinent past medical history, past surgical history, family history, and social history. Understand informal ways of asking about these aspects in Malaysian slang.
notes_for_scribe: Focus on conditions and events relevant to the chief complaint or overall health. Use abbreviations like PMH, PSH, FamHx, SocHx, and clarify any informal descriptions.

example_phrases_en: SocHx: Lives at home with spouse. Works as a teacher. Denies drug use. Reports feeling down lately.
example_phrases_ms: RSK: Tinggal di rumah bersama pasangan. Bekerja sebagai guru. Menyangkal penggunaan narkoba. Melaporkan merasa murung akhir-akhir ini.
gemini_instructions: Document relevant aspects of the patient's social history, considering the HEADSS mnemonic. Understand informal ways of discussing these sensitive topics in Malaysian slang.
notes_for_scribe: Be sensitive and thorough when inquiring about social factors that may impact health. Use neutral and respectful language.

example_phrases_en: ROS: Negative for fever, chills, nausea, vomiting.
Reports fatigue and occasional night sweats (positive for general symptoms).
Cardiovascular: Denies chest pain or palpitations.
example_phrases_ms: ROS: Negatif untuk demam, menggigil, mual, muntah.
Melaporkan kelelahan dan kadang-kadang berkeringat di malam hari (positif untuk gejala umum).
Kardiovaskular: Menyangkal sakit dada atau palpitasi.
Selain dari tu, ada rasa lain-lain?
gemini_instructions: Document a system-by-system review of any additional symptoms reported by the patient. Note both pertinent positives (symptoms present) and pertinent negatives (symptoms absent). Understand informal ways of inquiring about different body systems in Malaysian slang.
notes_for_scribe: Systematically go through each major body system. Pay attention to both what the patient reports and what they deny.
